description: Students explore major challenges affecting the world's people such as population, resource
management, economic integration, information, technology, conflict/security and governance
with an emphasis on their relation to global citizenship and human rights. This course examines
issues from social science and global problem-solving perspectives with particular attention to
how culture and place affect human experience. Students engage in discussions, forums, a
global village activity and an action project. Materials fee required. Offered during Interim.
